Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Gouge
Description: This is a limestone gouge in the shape of a grooved cylinder. One of the extremities is wider than the other (diametre 2,3 and 1,75 cm). Both surfaces are covered with plaster, which was used as an adhesive for two alabaster discs that have now disappeared. Numerous examples of these discs were also found in the same context.
